question_sets.context: Early rising is helpful in more than one way. First, it helps us to have good health. We all need fresh air. It makes our health better to take morning exercises. The air is never so fresh as early in the morning. Early rising helps us in our studies. In the morning we learn more quickly and find it easy to learn something by heart. Early rising makes people able to plan the work for the day. We can’t work well without a good plan. Just as the plan for the year should be made in the spring, the plan for a day should be made in the morning. Early rising gives us enough time to get ready for our work, such as to wash our hands and eat our breakfast. So the popular saying says, “Early to bed and early to rise makes a man healthy, wealthy(富有的) and wise.”

questions.text: What does “early rising” mean？It means _______ early in the morning.
questions.explanation: 根据文章第一句话可知，早起意味着早上起床。

questions.text: Why does the passage advise us to take exercises early in the morning？

choices.A: Because we can save much time.
choices.B: Because we are not busy in the morning.
choices.C: Because air in the morning is very fresh.
choices.D: Because we don’t need to prepare for breakfast.

questions.explanation: 文章中提到，早晨空气非常新鲜，所以建议我们早晨锻炼。
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Supporting Details

questions.text: We can work well with _____.
questions.explanation: 文章中提到，没有好的计划我们就不能好好工作。

question_sets.context: The word “day” has two meanings. When we talk about the number of days in a year, we are using “day” to mean 24 hours. But when we talk about day and night, we are using “day” to mean the time between sunrise and sunset. Since the earth looks like a ball, the sun can shine on only half of it at a time. Always one half of the earth is having day and the other half night. A place is moved from day into night and from night into day over and over by the spinning（旋转）of the earth. At the equator（赤道）day and night are sometimes the same length. They are each twelve hours long. The sun rises at 6 o’clock in the morning and sets at 6 o’clock in the evening. For six months the North Pole is tilted（倾斜）toward the sun. In those months the Northern Hemisphere（半球）gets more hours of sunlight than the Southern Hemisphere. Days are longer than nights. South of the equator nights are longer than days. For the other six months the North Pole is tilted away from the sun. Then the Southern Hemisphere gets more sunlight. Days are longer than nights. North of the equator nights are longer than days. Winter is the season of long nights. Summer is the season of long days.

questions.text: A place is moved from day into night and from night into day over and over by ______ of the earth.
questions.explanation: 根据文章内容，地球的旋转导致了昼夜交替。

questions.text: At the equator day is as long as night ________.
questions.explanation: 根据文章内容，赤道上昼夜有时一样长。

questions.text: When the North Pole is tilted toward the sun, the Northern Hemisphere gets ______ sunlight.
questions.explanation: 根据文章内容，当北极朝向太阳倾斜时，北半球获得更多的阳光。

question_sets.context:
Korean culture is really exciting right now. The Korean Wave is sweeping Asian countries including China. Young people are going crazy about Korean pop songs and the Korean language. The Korean Wave started a few years ago with the TV programmes “Winter Sonata”（冬季恋歌）. This love story is still popular. People, especially girls, like the beautiful story and handsome actors like Bae Young Jun.(裴勇俊)
In the music world, Korean girls are making themselves heard in China. You can often find big Korean names like Baby Vox, S.E.S. and Finkle at the top of the Chinese music charts (排行榜).The Korean Wave has also made young people want to try the clothes and hairstyles of pop stars, too. Not only that now some girls in China are having plastic surgery(整容) to change the way they look. People say some beautiful Korean stars have had plastic surgery. These stars don’t make plastic look shameful (丢了面子).
Are all the faces of beautiful Korean girls not real? Find out for yourself when you next visit South Korean.

questions.text: What does the Korea Wave refer to(指的是)? It refers to ___________.
questions.explanation: 根据文章第一句话，韩流指的是韩国文化。

questions.text: When did the Korean Wave start? It started with __________.
questions.explanation: 根据文章内容，韩流起始于电视剧《冬季恋歌》。

questions.text: Korean stars often change their looks by ______________.
questions.explanation: 根据文章内容，韩国明星经常通过整容来改变外貌。

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT true according to the passage?

choices.A: Winter Sonata tells a very famous love story
choices.B: Young people like Korean pop stars’ clothes and hairstyles
choices.C: Chinese girls also want to try plastic surgery.
choices.D: Korean pop stars think plastic surgery is shameful.

questions.explanation: 文章中说，韩国明星不认为整容是可耻的。

question_sets.context:
On June 30, 2009, a Yemenia airplane from Paris to Comoros, Africa, crashed into the Indian Ocean. There were 153 people on the plane, including some French officials. Though people have been searching since the plane went down, the result looked unpleasant, for most of the passengers might be in bad luck.
But a 13-year-old girl called Bahia Bakari was discovered in the water, where she had been staying afloat(漂浮的) by holding a piece of wreckage(残骸) from the plane tightly fo over 13 hours.
When they found her, the girl was too weak to catch he lifebuoy(救生圈) thrown to her, instead, a Comoran police officer, said Abdilai, jumped into the water to pull the child onto the boat.
Bahia Bakari was injured, especially her collarbone(锁骨).her father was pleased to see his daughter although his wife had gone away in this tragedy. He said that his daughter could hardly swim. It was really a miracle for her to escape in this way. In her daddy’s warm arms, the girl could soon remember what she had experienced. “I was thrown out of the plane and then I saw the plane fall into the water. Next I found myself in the water. I couldn’t swim very well and I caught something but I didn’t know what is was,” said the girl.
“She is really a lucky young girl,” said Alain Joyandet, France’s minister for International Cooperation.

questions.text: The Yemenia airplane took off in ____________.
questions.explanation: 根据文章内容，飞机从巴黎起飞。

questions.text: What does the underlined word “tragedy” mean in the passage?
questions.explanation: Tragedy指的是灾难。

questions.text: Bahia Bakari had been staying in the water for more than _________.
questions.explanation: 根据文章内容，Bahia Bakari在水中待了超过13个小时，也就是半天。

questions.text: Which of the following is TRUE according to the passage?

choices.A: Bahia Bakari was saved by the lifebuoy
choices.B: Bahia Bakari’s father saved his daughter
choices.C: Bahia Bakari’s mother died in the accident
choices.D: Bahia Bakari could swim well, so se escaped

questions.explanation: 根据文章内容，巴希亚·巴卡里的母亲在事故中去世。

questions.text: What’s the best title for the passage?
questions.explanation: 根据文章内容，这篇文章的最佳标题是《一个幸运的女孩》。

question_sets.context:
One Saturday, Tiantian got up as usual. When she walked into the kitchen, she noticed there were many eggs and some tea on the table. With a confused look on her face, Tiantian asked her mom, “Why are there so many eggs?” Her mother replied, “I’m going to make some tea eggs. Today is the Beginning of Summer. It is the 7th of the 24 traditional Chinese solar terms（节气）. It usually lasts for 15 days. During this period, people eat a tea egg each day.”
“Does the egg have any special meaning?” Tiantian asked.
“Yes. In ancient China, people believed the round egg was a symbol of a happy life. Eating eggs on the Beginning of Summer was a wish for good health. So they put tea into boiled water together with eggs and created ‘tea eggs’.”
“It sounds interesting! Let me help you make tea eggs,” Tiantian said.

questions.text: The story happened .
questions.explanation: The passage mentions Tiantian woke up as usual and went to the kitchen, which implies it was morning.

questions.text: The underlined word “confused” means “ ” in Chinese.
questions.explanation: The word 'confused' translates to '疑惑的' (yí huò de) in Chinese, meaning puzzled or uncertain.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Contextual Vocabulary; Synonym Replacement

questions.text: The Beginning of Summer period usually lasts for days.
questions.explanation: The passage states that the Beginning of Summer usually lasts for 15 days.

questions.text: Why did ancient people eat eggs on the Beginning of Summer?

choices.B: To hope for a rich life.

questions.explanation: The passage explains that eating eggs on the Beginning of Summer was a wish for good health.

question_sets.context:
Roy felt unhappy. Why do all wolves have to do everything together? They eat together, sleep together and walk together. Roy was tired of this way of life. He thought he was old enough to live alone.
One day, the wolf pack（群）went through the forest looking for food. Roy said, “Why do we have to go together? I can find my own food. I don’t need you!” The wolves told Roy they needed to work together and help each other. Roy didn’t believe them. He left.
He got tired after running for miles, and it was getting dark. Usually, wolves slept together, but Roy was alone. He decided to find a place to sleep. He thought, “Sleeping would be much easier with my pack around me. If anything happens, they’ll protect me.” Roy didn’t sleep well that night.
Roy thought he made the wrong choice. So the next morning, he decided to go back to his pack. Suddenly, something ran towards him. It was a tiger! He ran as fast as he could. Finally, he was out of danger.
Roy thought it would be great if his pack were here. With his pack by his side, he wouldn’t be in danger. He realized that what his pack said was right. For wolves, it is important to work together.

questions.text: Why did Roy feel unhappy?

choices.A: Because the wolf pack treated him badly.
choices.B: Because he wanted to live on his own.
choices.C: Because Roy couldn’t find the wolf pack.

questions.explanation: The passage states that Roy was tired of the wolves always doing everything together and he thought he was old enough to live alone.

questions.text: What do we know about Roy’s first night away from his pack?
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that Roy didn't sleep well and thought sleeping would be easier with his pack around him, suggesting he missed them.

questions.text: What does the “wrong choice” refer to?
questions.explanation: Roy thought he made the wrong choice after spending a night alone, indicating that leaving his pack was the wrong choice.

questions.text: What can you learn from Roy’s story?

choices.A: There is no place like home.

questions.explanation: The moral of the story is that for wolves, and by extension, in many situations, teamwork is important, as Roy realized after facing danger alone.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Main Idea Identification; Inference Skills

question_sets.context:
Is it difficult for you to get up in the morning ? Hiroyuki’s bed will solve your problem ! Here is how it works .
The bed is connected to an alarm clock . First , the alarm clock rings . You have a few minutes to wake up . Next , a tape recorder in the bed plays soft music . The tape recorder in Hiroyuki’s bed plays a recording of his girlfriend . She whispered in a soft voice , “Wake up , darling , please .” After minutes later , Hiroyuki hears a recording of his boss . His boss shouts , “Wake up at once , or you’ll be late !”.
If you don’t get up after the second recording , a mechanical “foot” in the bed will kick you in the head . The bed waits a few more minutes . What ! You’re still in bed ! Slowly the top of the bed rises higher and higher . The foot of the bed goes lower and lower . Finally you slide off the bed and onto the floor . You are out of bed awake !
Hiroyuki’s bed is not in stores . There is only one bed--- the bed Hiroyuki made for a contest（竞赛）. Maybe someday a company will make Hiroyuki’s bed and sell it in stores . Maybe people will buy millions of beds . Then Hiroyuki will be rich . If the bed makes Hiroyuki rich , he won’t need to work , and he won’t need to get up early !

questions.text: The bed is useful to the people <blank> .
questions.explanation: 根据文章第一句话可知，这个床对早上起不来的人有用。

questions.text: The bed is not connected to <blank> .
questions.explanation: 根据文章内容可知，这个床没有连接电视。

questions.text: What will finally happen to Hiroyuki if he doesn’t get up ?

choices.A: He will slide onto the floor.
choices.B: A tape recorder will play a recording of his boss.
choices.C: A mechanical “foot” will kick him in the head.
choices.D: The bed will rise higher and higher

questions.explanation: 根据文章内容可知，如果Hiroyuki不起床，他最终会滑到地板上。

questions.text: Which is TRUE of the following sentences?

choices.A: Hiroyuki’s company has made many such beds .
choices.B: Hiroyuki’s bed is the only one made for a contest .
choices.C: Hiroyuki has made a lot of money .
choices.D: Hiroyuki needn’t get up early now .

questions.explanation: 根据文章内容可知，Hiroyuki的床是唯一一个为比赛制作的。

questions.text: The word “whisper” in the second paragraph means “<blank> ” .
questions.explanation: whisper意思是“轻声说”，speak quietly意思是“安静地说”。
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Contextual Vocabulary; Synonym Replacement

question_sets.context:
A man went to a fast-food restaurant to buy his lunch . ‘Hi’ , an assistant(服务员) said . ‘May I
help you ?’
‘I’d like a hamburger , large chips , and a coke , ’ the man said .
‘Anything else ?’ the assistant asked .
‘No,’ the man answered . ‘That is it .’
‘Is that for here or to go ?’ the assistant asked .
‘To go .’ the man said .
The assistant put the man’s lunch in a bag . The man took out his money and paid forhis lunch .
‘Thank you .’ the assistant said . ‘Have a nice day.’
The man took the bag and walked to a park . He sat down and opened the bag . He was amazed .
There was no hamburger in the bag . There were no chips . There was no coke . There was only money in the bag ----- a lot of money ! The man counted the money . Two thousand dollars ! Why was the money in the bag ? Where was the man’s lunch ?
The manager of the fast-food restaurant needed to go to the bank . He put two thousand dollars
in an envelope (信封) . He put the envelope in a bag and put the bag down . The worker gave the manager’s bag to the man by mistake . So the manager had a hamburger , chips and a coke, and the man had two thousand dollars . What should the man do ?

questions.text: The man went to a restaurant to <blank> .
questions.explanation: 根据文章第一句话可知，这个男人去餐馆是为了买午餐。

questions.text: The man wanted to have his lunch <blank> .
questions.explanation: 根据文章内容可知，这个男人想在公园里吃午餐。

questions.text: When the man opened the bag , he found <blank> in it .
questions.explanation: 根据文章内容可知，这个男人打开袋子后，发现里面是钱。

questions.text: How many people are mentioned (提到) in this story ?
questions.explanation: 根据文章内容可知，这个故事里提到了两个人，分别是顾客和经理。

questions.text: How many kinds of food did the man ask for ?
questions.explanation: 根据文章内容可知，这个男人点了三种食物，分别是汉堡、薯条和可乐。

question_sets.context:
Dear Joy,
Thank you for agreeing to water our plants for us while we are away. Here is what you need to do.
1. The vegetable in the garden need to be watered every day unless it rains. There is a large area of bare soil, but this needs to be watered, too. Betty planted some corn there. Please pick any vegetables that are ripe and use them. It’s a shame for them to go to waste.
2. The garden at the front of the house only needs to be watered every two or three days. The plants there are quite strong and will survive a few days without water. The roses are starting to bloom. If you look after them, they should be all right for a week or more. They will last a bit longer if you put a little sugar in the water. That’s some advice my grandmother gave me a long time ago.
3. There are a few plants in the pots on the porch, and these need to be watered well every day. I’ve left a couple of pots out in the sun, and these also need lots of water. You can pick any strawberries that are ripe and eat them. You’ll find they are delicious.
4. You don’t need to do anything for the lemon tree. If you see any ripe lemons, just pick them and take them home. You can use them in cooking for to make lemonade(柠檬汁)
Thanks again for helping out. We’ll see you in two weeks. You’ve got our telephone number, so please call us if there are any problems or if you need to ask any questions. We’ll send you a post-card.

questions.text: Lee wrote these instructions to Joy because Lee <blank>.
questions.explanation: The first sentence of the passage implies that Lee is going on holiday.

questions.text: What does NOT need watering every day?
questions.explanation: According to the text, the lemon tree does not need watering.

questions.text: Which of the following is TRUE according to the passage?

choices.A: Joy will send Lee a postcard.
choices.B: Lee will come home in three weeks.
choices.C: Lee likes to grow his own vegetables.
choices.D: Lee’s house is not very big.

questions.explanation: The passage indicates that Lee grows vegetables in the garden.

questions.text: How should Joy deal with the lemon tree?

choices.C: Pick ripe lemons, and take them home.

questions.explanation: According to the passage, Joy should pick the ripe lemons and take them home.

questions.text: What does “ripe fruit” mean?

choices.A: The fruit is ready to eat.
choices.B: The fruit is hard and bitter.
choices.D: The fruit is starting to grow.

questions.explanation: Ripe fruit is ready to eat.

question_sets.context:
A man was fishing on the bank of a river. A boy came to see him fishing. The man was really good at fishing and he could catch a full basket of fish in a short time. The man saw that the boy was very cute, and he wanted to give him a whole basket of fish. But the boy shook his head. The man was surprised and asked, "Why don't you want the fish? '  The boy replied," I want the fishing rod(竿)in your hands. "  The man asked," Why do you want the rod?"  "I will eat up all the fish in the basket soon,but if I have the fishing rod,I can use it to catch a lot of fish by myself.”   Many people will certainly say the boy is very smart...wrong! If he doesn't know fishing skills. He can’t catch fish without a fishing rod.It’s useless to only have a fishing rod, fishing skills are more important than having a fishing rod.
Many people want to have a "fishing rod" in their life. They are just like the boy, they thought that if they had a fishing rod, they would have fish to eat.Life is full of exciting things,we should try to learn fishing skills instead of having a fishing rod.

questions.text: The man was fishing on the bank of________.
questions.explanation: The first sentence mentions 'a river'.

questions.text: Why did the boy refuse the man’s fish?

choices.B: Because he wanted his fishing rod.
choices.C: Because he wanted some big fish
choices.D: Because he wanted to have fishing skills.

questions.explanation: The boy said he wanted the fishing rod.

questions.text: Many people thought the boy was_____after he explained why he didn't want the fish.
questions.explanation: The passage says 'Many people will certainly say the boy is very smart...wrong!'

questions.text: Life is full exciting things,we should try to _____.
questions.explanation: The passage says 'Life is full of exciting things,we should try to learn fishing skills'.

questions.text: What is the best tide(标题)for the article?
questions.explanation: The passage mainly talks about the importance of learning fishing skills.

question_sets.context:
Beijing Opera is one of the Chinese traditional drama art forms and the largest Chinese opera form. Having a history of about 200 years， it is developed from many other drama form， mostly from the local drama "Hui ban". It was especially popular in south China during the 18th century. 
Theatrical （喜剧的） art forms in many other countries do not have singing， dancing and spoken parts together in one single drama. An opera singer， for example， neither dances nor speaks on stage；there are no singing or dancing parts in a modern play；in a dance drama， the dancer doesn't speak or sing. Traditional Chinese drama， including Beijing Opera， is a kind of entertainment. It includes spoken parts， singing and dancing.
Beijing Opera has spread to many other places. Mei Lanfang， one of the most famous performers of all， was the first to introduce Beijing Opera to foreigners and made highly successful tours to foreign countries.
"You will doubt and sometimes be a little bored， but you will be interested  gradually. You will be strongly attracted to Beijing Opera， even if you know nothing about the drama background." This is how one traveler described his first experience in watching Beijing Opera.
Beijing Opera is China's national opera and it in full of Chinese cultural traditions. Welcome to China and enjoy Beijing Opera!

questions.text: Beijing Opera is_______.

choices.B: only developed from the local drama "Huiban"
choices.C: a much larger Chinese opera form
choices.D: a Chinese traditional drama art form

questions.explanation: The first sentence mentions 'Beijing Opera is one of the Chinese traditional drama art forms'.

questions.text: After watching Beijing Opera for the first time， the traveler felt_______.
questions.explanation: The traveler felt interested gradually.

questions.text: The underlined word "it " in the last paragraph means
questions.explanation: The 'it' refers to Beijing Opera.

questions.text: According to the passage， which of the following statements is NOT true?

choices.A: Beijing Opera is a kind of entertainment.
choices.B: An opera singer neither dances nor speaks on stage usually.
choices.C: Only old people are interested in Beijing Opera.
choices.D: Mei Lanfang was the first one to introduce Beijing Opera to foreigners.

questions.explanation: The passage doesn't mention that only old people are interested in Beijing Opera.

questions.text: The main purpose of writing the passage is to

choices.A: ask young people to learn Beijing Opera
choices.B: tell us something about Beijing Opera
choices.C: show why Beijing Opera is popular in Europe

questions.explanation: The main purpose is to tell us something about Beijing Opera.

question_sets.context:
Just a Quick Nap 只要打个盹儿
Do you feel a little sleepy after lunch? Well, that’s normal. Your body naturally slows down then. What should you do about it? Don’t reach for a coffee! Instead, take a nap. 
It’s good to have a daily nap. First of all , you are more efficient（有效的） after napping . You remember things better and make fewer mistakes. Also, you can learn things more easily after taking a nap. A nap may increase your self-confidence（自信） and make you more active . It may even cheer you up. But, there are some simple rules you should follow about taking a nap. First, take a nap in the middle of day, about eight hours after you wake up. Next, a 20-minute nap is best. If you sleep longer, you may fall into a deep sleep. After waking from a deep sleep, you will feel worse. Also, you should set an alarm clock. That way, you can fully relax during your nap. You won’t have to keep looking at the clock so you don’t oversleep.
Now，the next time you feel sleepy after lunch , don’t get stressed . Put your head down, close your eyes, and catch forty winks.

questions.text: It is <blank> to get sleepy for you at noon.
questions.explanation: The first sentence in the second paragraph states that it's normal to feel sleepy after lunch.

questions.text: After taking a nap, you may feel more<blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage says that a nap may increase your self-confidence.

questions.text: The proper period（一段时间）of time for taking a nap is <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage states that a 20-minute nap is best.

questions.text: What can help you have a fully relaxing nap according to the passage?
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that you should set an alarm clock to fully relax during your nap.

questions.text: What is the text mainly about?

choices.A: Why and how to take a nap.
choices.C: How to make your body slow down.

questions.explanation: The passage discusses the benefits of taking a nap and provides rules on how to take one.

question_sets.context:
More and more advertisements appear on the Web. You have to be careful not to be fooled or tricked(欺骗) by the advertisements on the Internet. Something is said to be a bargain, but it isn’t always cheap. And some so-called new things just have a new outside. 
However, shopping online is a kind of fashionable thing today. I love to buy things for everyday use, so I often get lots of information about them on websites online. For example, if I want an MP4, I can choose my favorite one, and look for what the users like or don’t like about it, then decide whether to buy or not. And at the same time, you don’t have to go to a shop or walk around a crowded shopping area, so you don’t have to waste much time. The Internet is really useful for shopping, but be careful not to spend too much.

questions.text: If you want to shop online, you should <blank>.

choices.D: be careful not to be fooled

questions.explanation: The passage suggests being cautious about online advertisements.

questions.text: What does the writer think of the advertisements online?
questions.explanation: The writer warns against being fooled or tricked by online advertisements.

questions.text: What does the underlined word “bargain” in the passage probably mean?
questions.explanation: Bargain refers to something that is cheap.

questions.text: What does the writer often buy online?
questions.explanation: The writer mentions buying an MP4 as an example.

questions.text: If you shop online, you<blank>.

choices.D: can only buy things with a new outside

questions.explanation: The writer indicates that online shopping saves time.

question_sets.context:
Dear Victor: 
I am a college student. Nowadays games on the net are very popular with college students. Some of my roommates are very interested in them. They not only play games in their free time, but also keep talking about them at night when lights are off, and they regard games as part of life. I’ve begged(乞求) them to give it up, but they wouldn’t listen to me. It has become a rather big problem. Should I report it to our teachers or do something else? 
Ted
Dear Ted: 
Drop it. Your roommates, as grown-ups, can do whatever they want with their time so long as it doesn’t break school rules or violate(防碍) other people’s interests. 
Playing perhaps gives these students relaxation(放松) from hard study. If they play too often, have little time to study, and they will reap what they have sown, but you will not. Reporting to the teachers would only harm your good name in your dormitory(宿舍). However you have rights to ask your roommates to be quiet when you need sleep. If they aren’t angry with you, they will stop talking. But be polite and friendly. Perhaps, in return, join them in a game or two. 
Victor.

questions.text: According to the first letter, many college students enjoy<blank>.
questions.explanation: The first letter states that games on the net are very popular with college students.

questions.text: Ted wants his roommates to<blank>.

choices.D: play games in the day, not at night

questions.explanation: Ted has begged his roommates to give up playing games.

questions.text: According to the second letter, some college students<blank>.

choices.A: can violate school rules or other people’s interests
choices.B: have their rights to quarrel with Ted
choices.C: can relax themselves while playing games on the net
choices.D: can study even better if they play games on the net

questions.explanation: Victor suggests that playing games gives these students relaxation from hard study.

questions.text: Victor asks Ted to<blank>.

choices.B: harm his good name in the dormitory
choices.D: learn how to get on well with others

questions.explanation: Victor advises Ted to be polite and friendly, and perhaps join them in a game or two.

questions.text: In the second letter, the underlined part(划线部分) means<blank>.
questions.explanation: Reap what they have sown means 'bear the consequences of one's actions'.

question_sets.context: Mr. Grey was the boss of a small factory in London. He lived in the country, and came to work by train. He liked walking from the station to his office if it was not raining, because it gave him some exercise. One morning he was walking along the street when a stranger stopped him and said to him,"You may not remember me, sir, but seven years ago I came to London without any money in my pocket. I stopped you in this street and asked you to lend me some money, and you lent me five pounds（英镑）, because you said that you were happy to take a chance so as to give a man a start on the road to success." Mr. Grey thought for a few moments and then said, "Yes, I remember you. Go on with your story." "Well," answered the stranger," are you still willing to take a chance again?"

questions.text: Mr. Grey walked to his office when the weather was not <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage states that he liked walking to his office if it was not raining.

questions.text: Mr. Grey gave the stranger <blank> a few years ago.
questions.explanation: The stranger mentioned that Mr. Grey lent him five pounds.

questions.text: What do you think of the stranger?
questions.explanation: The stranger is attempting to get more money from Mr. Grey by reminding him of the past, suggesting he's clever.

question_sets.context:
"Be proud of what you do," my father always told me, "whether you are a boss or a cleaner." When I was 15, I got a summer job in a hospital. I was told that my duties would include（包含）sweeping floor. I smiled and remembered Dad's words.
Even though my job was the lowest, it made me feel excited. I saw it as a challenge（挑战）because it was my first job, I learned to be on time and tried to do everything well. In return, I was treated with respect by doctors, nurses and patients. Each morning I imagined that the dirty dishes would make patients sicker if I was not there to wash them clean. After breakfast was done, I started sweeping floors of all patient rooms and cleaning toilets. Though I was tired, I wanted the job to be done well. People would say, "That young boy really does a good job." That give me a pride.
Working in the hospital taught me that being proud of one's job is important. It does not matter whether the job is sweeping floors or managing a large business. Through every job I have ever had, my father's words have always stayed with me. I have swept floors, and I have been a manager. I think Dad would be proud of me.

questions.text: The writer's first job was a <blank>.
questions.explanation: The writer got a job in a hospital where his duties included sweeping floors.

questions.text: The writer's summer job in a hospital didn't include <blank>.
questions.explanation: The writer's duties included sweeping the floor, washing dishes, and cleaning toilets.

questions.text: The writer thought his first job was <blank>.
questions.explanation: The writer felt excited and saw it as a challenge and felt that it was important because it was his first job.

questions.text: Which is the best title of the passage?
questions.explanation: The main idea of the passage is about the importance of being proud of one's job.

question_sets.context:
Every year there are many people going home on long -distance buses during the Spring Festival and the Tomb-sweeping Day. There are more walkers on their way home or to work on the roads. So there are more and more traffic accidents on the roads. Thanks to the efforts of the traffic police, it is said the number of traffic accidents across China in 2019 was 25.2 percent fewer than that in 2018 during the three-day Tomb-sweeping Day.
Tomb-sweeping Day, is also known as Qingming Festival. It is an important occasion for Chinese to honor their ancestors（祖先）. Most people go home in memory of their ancestors on that day. About 9.78 million Chinese visited cemeteries to honor their ancestors or relatives during the holiday. So transportation safety is a big problem.
On the other hand, it is said Chinese have made 112 million trips during the holiday, up 10.9 percent from last year's holiday. For the traffic accidents, some people lost their lives. This year, traffic accidents caused 10 deaths during the three-day Tomb-sweeping Day.
The fewer traffic accidents are all from the efforts of the police and our government. With the development of society and the government's efforts, I believe everything will change better.

questions.text: During the Qingming Festival, the number of traffic accidents in 2019 was about <blank> fewer than that in 2018.
questions.explanation: 25.2 percent is approximately a quarter.

questions.text: The underlined word “cemeteries” in Paragraph 2 means“<blank>” in Chinese.
questions.explanation: The meaning of cemeteries is 墓地.

questions.text: The traffic accidents reduced during the Tomb-sweeping Day in 2019 because <blank>.

choices.A: fewer people made trips during the holiday
choices.B: there were more walkers on their way home
choices.C: the police and our government made their efforts

questions.explanation: The last paragraph mentions that fewer traffic accidents are from the efforts of the police and the government.

questions.text: You may probably read the passage <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage discusses traffic accidents and statistics, which are typically found in newspapers.

question_sets.context:
In order to protect environment, it is very important to learn about the environment. There are many ways to understand how to protect the environment, such as reading books, asking someone and so on. You are students. In your spare time, you can read as many as books. Books in the library are worth reading. They will help you learn. Ask your classmates or librarians for some suggestions. They have good ideas. You can also get information about the environment on some good websites. Besides these, I have some suggestions.
In our everyday life, some people use less energy by sharing a car. For example, three or four persons can ride together in one car instead of driving three or four cars to work. Usually it is time-saving and convenient to share cars with their neighbors to take their children to school. Whenever we use electricity, we should tum off lights, the TV, the computer and so on when we don't use them.
On the other hand, we should use energy-saving products. Some products, like environment-friendly new energy cars, are made specially to save energy. These cars can travel longer than ordinary cars. They produce less pollution, too. Some products like computers and TVs with the energy star label（标签）are made to save energy.
Secondly, we should buy recyclable products instead of non- recyclable ones. Recyclable products usually take less energy. When we go shopping, pay attention to the recycle mark on the package: make a circle and three arrows.

questions.text: The passage is mainly written for <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage directly addresses 'you are students' and gives suggestions on how to learn about the environment.

questions.text: <blank> produce less pollution.
questions.explanation: The passage states that new energy cars produce less pollution.

questions.text: When we go shopping, we should pay attention to <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that we should pay attention to the recycle mark on the package.

questions.text: From the passage, we can learn <blank>.

choices.A: how to turn off the electricity

questions.explanation: The passage discusses several ways to protect the environment.

question_sets.context:
My teacher, Mrs. Palmquist, makes us do our homework every day. I always do my homework. I don’t want Mrs. Palmquist to be upset with me and I like to get good grades in school.
There is a student in our class who never does his homework. His name is Bobby. He always says that he forgot what to do. None of us understood why he didn’t do his homework. It wasn’t hard and it didn’t take long to complete.
The week before our winter break, Mrs. Palmquist gave us homework passes，so we did not have to do homework one night without any trouble. Some of us were surprised when Mrs. Palmquist gave Bobby a homework pass. Why would she give him one? Bobby didn’t do his homework and he was being rewarded (奖励). That wasn’t fair.
The next day Bobby didn’t come to school. Mrs. Palmquist told us that Bobby had been very sick. He went to the doctors, but it didn’t work. Then he was put in the hospital so that they could help him get better. We were all very sad. 
The class decided to help Bobby with his homework problem. During our free time we made Bobby cards. Each card had a special gift inside. Every student gave Bobby his or her homework pass. 
Mrs. Palmquist had tears in her eyes when she realized what we had done. She told us that she was very proud of our actions and cancelled homework for one week. 
A few months later, Bobby returned to school. He was better. The doctors helped cure Bobby of his illness. Every day after his return, Bobby completed his homework. He didn’t need our gifts after all. Mrs. Palmquist told us that he used our passes every day when he was sick. I learned a lot in Mrs. Palmquist’s class that year. My mom says I learned more than I realized. Adults sure are funny!

questions.text: The writer does her homework every day <blank>.
questions.explanation: The writer mentions she likes to get good grades in school.

questions.text: With the homework passes, the students <blank>

choices.A: didn’t need to do their homework
choices.B: should do their homework at home
choices.C: could pass exams and get good grades
choices.D: didn’t get homework from Mrs. Palmquist

questions.explanation: The passage states they didn't have to do homework one night.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is NOT TRUE?

choices.A: Bobby didn’t do his homework because of his illness.
choices.B: Bobby’s classmates were sad when they knew he was ill.
choices.C: Bobby used his own homework passes to get out of trouble.
choices.D: Mrs. Palmquist didn’t give her students homework for a week.

questions.explanation: The passage says the classmates gave their homework passes to Bobby.

questions.text: Which of the following is probably the best title for the passage?
questions.explanation: The special gift of homework passes plays a key role in the story.

question_sets.context:
It’s hard to believe how times have changed since the first modern Olympics were held in Athens, Greece, on 6th April 1896. One hundred years ago, there was very little reliance (dependence) on modern technology. There were no landing mats (海绵垫), no stopwatches and no photo finishes. In fact, cameras and stopwatches were not used until the 1932 Olympic Games in Los Angeles, USA.
Today technology has completely revolutionized (changed) sports. Take sports equipment (装备) for example. Starting blocks are now equipped with electronic pressure sensors, which, together with digital cameras, provide exactly correct race time and also help to catch runners who “jump the gun”. As athletes cross the finishing line, special digital cameras can also easily decide the winner. The days of “dead heats” are gone. 
Athletes have also benefited (受益) from technological developments. Body-hugging suits, which reduce (减少) wind drag, can help cut up to one-tenth of a second from runners’ race times. Top athletes are even provided with tailor-made sports shoes. These shoes are made to fit the athlete exactly -- and there are even air compartments in the shoes that can be filled to meet each runner’s individual needs.
Technology has also changed the way that many sports are performed. Take one example -- the pole vault (撑杆跳). The inclusion of a landing mat obviously made a big difference to the vaulting style (方式) as athletes no longer needed to worry about hurting themselves as they fell. Without these worries, athletes could obviously jump higher. These days, pole vaulters do not even need to worry about the crossbar as the uprights are now fitted with light-emitting diodes (LEDs) that measure (测量) how high the athlete vaulted. Even it has been to the advantage of swimmers. New pools have been designed to reduce wave interference and sports scientists have even developed a new style of swimming that increases buoyancy and reduces drag in the water.
The increasing importance of these technological developments has led many sportsmen to suggest that the “Olympic spirit” is being lost in a rush to break records and win medals. Many developing countries say that technology has become too important in sport and that athletes from developing countries that cannot afford such technology are disadvantaged. There are no easy answers but one thing is sure -- we cannot turn back times. Technology cannot go backwards.

questions.text: How many pieces of high-tech sports equipment are mentioned in Paragraph 2 and 3?
questions.explanation: Starting blocks with electronic pressure sensors, digital cameras, body-hugging suits, and tailor-made sports shoes are mentioned.

questions.text: The underlined phrase “dead heats” means <blank>.

choices.A: sports equipment which was out of date
choices.B: runners who jumped the gun while running
choices.C: diseases which killed runners in hot weather
choices.D: races in which runners finished at the same time

questions.explanation: 'Dead heats' refer to races where runners finish at the same time.

questions.text: What can be inferred from the fourth paragraph?

choices.A: LEDs can measure the speed of swimming.
choices.B: The pole vault was not quite safe in the past.
choices.C: Pole vaulters jump higher with landing mats.
choices.D: New pools have changed the style of swimming.

questions.explanation: The paragraph implies that pole vaulting was less safe without landing mats.

questions.text: The purpose of the writer in writing this article is <blank>.

choices.A: to suggest we should keep up with the times
choices.B: to show us the future of modern Olympics
choices.C: to prove that the athletes have done better

questions.explanation: The writer discusses the impact of technology on sports and suggests we cannot turn back time.
